text.text: BBC Home - Breaking News, World News, US News, Sports, Business, Innovation, Climate, Culture, Travel, Video & Audio Skip to content British Broadcasting Corporation Home News Sport Business Innovation Culture Arts Travel Earth Audio Video Live Home News Israel-Gaza War War in Ukraine US & Canada UK UK Politics England N. Ireland N. Ireland Politics Scotland Scotland Politics Wales Wales Politics Africa Asia China India Australia Europe Latin America Middle East In Pictures BBC InDepth BBC Verify Sport Business Executive Lounge Technology of Business Future of Business Innovation Technology Science & Health Artificial Intelligence AI v the Mind Culture Film & TV Music Art & Design Style Books Entertainment News Arts Arts in Motion Travel Destinations Africa Antarctica Asia Australia and Pacific Caribbean & Bermuda Central America Europe Middle East North America South America World’s Table Culture & Experiences Adventures The SpeciaList Earth Natural Wonders Weather & Science Climate Solutions Sustainable Business Green Living Audio Podcast Categories Radio Audio FAQs Video BBC Maestro Live Live News Live Sport Home News Sport Business Innovation Culture Arts Travel Earth Audio Video Live Weather Newsletters LIVE Putin 'morally responsible' for 'unsurvivable' Novichok poisoning of British woman, inquiry finds An inquiry into Ms Sturgess' death in 2018 came after an attempt to poison an ex-Russian double agent living in Salisbury. Ukraine and US negotiators to meet in Florida after Moscow talks, White House says US special envoy Steve Witkoff will meet senior Ukrainian negotiator, Rustem Umerov, for talks in Miami on Thursday. 3 hrs ago Europe LIVE Putin 'morally responsible' for 'unsurvivable' Novichok poisoning of British woman, inquiry finds An inquiry into Ms Sturgess' death in 2018 came after an attempt to poison an ex-Russian double agent living in Salisbury. Ukraine and US negotiators to meet in Florida after Moscow talks, White House says US special envoy Steve Witkoff will meet senior Ukrainian negotiator, Rustem Umerov, for talks in Miami on Thursday. 3 hrs ago Europe Oil, defence and geopolitics: Why Putin is visiting Modi in Delhi BBC editors explain what is at stake as Russian President Vladimir Putin starts a two-day visit to India. 13 hrs ago World Trump and Infantino - too close for comfort? Friday’s World Cup draw in Washington DC will be the latest illustration of the ever-closer relationship between US President Donald Trump and Fifa president Gianni Infantino. 5 hrs ago World Cup Newly released video shows Jeffrey Epstein's private island home Democrats released a new tranche of materials obtained through a subpoena to the US Virgin Islands, where the residence is located. 16 hrs ago World 'Not becoming of a president': Somali-Americans respond to Trump's 'garbage' remarks Somali-Americans tell of their heightened fear after the US president intensified his criticism of the community. 8 hrs ago US & Canada UK and Norway form naval alliance to hunt Russian submarines The partnership is designed to protect undersea cables, which Western officials say are increasingly under threat from Moscow. 2 hrs ago Europe Only from the BBC How extreme heat could disrupt the 2026 World Cup and what fans can do about it With the World Cup draw set to take place on Friday, fans and businesses have been warned that extreme heat, bad weather and poor air quality could cost them. Could Japan's 'snow monsters' soon vanish? An iconic natural wonder unique to the Japanese winter, known as "juhyo", is under threat. But scientists and locals are working to revive it. Recommended Audio The Global Story How did a Chinese spiritual movement build a US media empire? Save In Our Time Pauli's Exclusion Principle (Archive Episode) Save Outlook Annie Ernaux: ‘My mum burned my teenage diaries’ Save Witness History Wole Soyinka: Imprisoned during Nigeria’s Biafra war Save The Documentary Podcast Made in Russia: The Kremlin’s economic rebrand Save Business Daily The making of a World Cup Save Outlook The pioneer senator rewriting the rules in Ireland Save Witness History Escaping Nigeria's Biafra war Save The Documentary Podcast From rocks to riches Save The Interview The Interview Save More news 'My heart breaks every time I'm called a hero': Hong Kong fire survivor A survivor tells the BBC he feels guilty he didn't save more people from the blaze at his block of flats. 14 hrs ago Asia Root's first ton in Australia keeps England afloat Joe Root finally makes a century in Australia to keep England afloat on a riveting first day of the second Ashes Test in Brisbane. 1 hr ago Cricket Indian scientists spot Milky Way-like galaxy from 12 billion years ago The galaxy's discovery challenges our understanding of how galaxies were formed in the early period after the Big Bang. 7 hrs ago Asia Melbourne ex-childcare worker charged with more child rape offences Alleged paedophile Joshua Dale Brown faces an extra 83 charges with four new victims identified. 11 hrs ago Australia Meta starts kicking Australian children off Instagram and Facebook The tech giant has started closing accounts for under-16s, a week before Australia's world-first official ban. 8 hrs ago Australia Israel says Palestinian groups returned body of Thai hostage held in Gaza The remains of agricultural worker Suthisak Rintalak were recovered by Hamas and Palestinian Islamic Jihad in northern Gaza. 3 hrs ago Middle East South Korea developing app that shows real-time location of stalkers Critics have voiced concern over the pervasiveness of stalking and violence against women in South Korea. 8 hrs ago Asia Must watch Banquet, Royal Family and Starmer on first day of German state visit The Royal Family hosted the first German state visit to the UK in 27 years - with a state banquet and ceremonial events in Windsor. Europe Explore the park that turned rubbish into a nature haven Freshkills Park is slated to become New York City's largest park, but it was once the largest landfill. Nature What Tennessee's special election means for the Republican party Republican Matt Van Epps won, but his margin of victory was less than half of what it was just over a year ago for President Trump in the same district. US & Canada Analysis: Putin showing no signs of compromise The BBC's Russia Editor shares his analysis after five hours of peace talks between the Russians and the US. Europe Driver hoisted to safety from truck dangling over West Virginia bridge A man was hoisted to safety and uninjured after his truck partly skated off an icy bridge road in the US US & Canada Teenager to fulfill dream dancing on Broadway Finn, 16, from Consett, is picked to fulfil a dream dancing on New York's Broadway at Christmas. Wear Moment snowboarder is rescued from stuck chairlift Thirteen other people were also safely lowered to the ground after a power outage hit the Sunburst Ski Area in the US state of Wisconsin. US & Canada US Capitol Christmas tree is lit up in Washington The tree, named "Silver Belle", was hand-selected from the Humboldt-Toiyabe National Forest in Nevada. US & Canada Art & Design Eight paint colours that can transform your home As Pantone announces its colour of 2026, here's more on the reasoning behind the choice – and what other trending shades can help you achieve greater domestic bliss. See more World of Business How family firms can best plan for succession The Murdochs had a much-reported inheritance battle, but smoother transitions are possible. See more US & Canada news Previously unseen images of Epstein's island released The new images come as a deadline for the broader release of documents held by the US government looms. Hegseth could have endangered troop safety with Signal chat - Pentagon watchdog Drunk raccoon found passed out on liquor store floor after breaking in Trump administration to roll back fuel economy rules set under Biden More world news Honduras election on knife-edge as count delayed by technical glitch Vote counting in the presidential election is going into its fourth day with the two top candidates neck and neck. More than 300 flights cancelled as Indian airline faces 'staff shortage' Who are the released hostages? Singapore court upholds guilty verdict for opposition leader Pritam Singh Business Court sides with Adidas in appeal over Kanye West collaboration Investors had accused Adidas of misleading them as its relationship with the rapper showed cracks. Russia bans Roblox over concerns about safety and extremist content A 355-year-old Royal Charter that survived the blitz auctioned for $13m in Canada Airbus to inspect some planes over 'quality issue' with panels Sport 'Australia will have to admit he's a great' - Root hits elusive century Joe Root ends his long wait for a Test century in Australia by reaching three figures on day one of the second Ashes Test in Brisbane. Iran to attend World Cup draw after boycott threat Newcastle want to be 'top club in world' by 2030 'It's hard to take... it hurts' - Fin Smith on losing England place Latest Sport Audio Test Match Special The Ashes: Root scores first hundred in Australia. Save BBC Women's Football Weekly Extra: Maya Le Tissier on growing up in Guernsey, the Lionesses & Mocha! Save Football Daily Leeds stun Chelsea, Villa win thriller & O’Neill bows out Save Football Daily 72+ EFL Pod: Boro bounce back & Jungle Jobi Save Rugby Union Weekly The Nations Pod: World Cup draw special Save More Than The Score As Ronnie O’Sullivan reaches his half-century will Snooker ever see another player like him? Save Test Match Special Stokes speaks to TMS as Cummins could return Save FPL Podcast from BBC Sport The Haaland Triple Captain Support Group Save Tech Porn site fined £1m over age checks has never responded to Ofcom The regulator tells the BBC it has been emailing AVS Group Ltd without reply since July. Robotic dogs part of wildfire detection trial Australia is banning social media for kids under 16. How will it work? India scraps order to pre-install state-run cyber safety app on smartphones Science & health They contracted hepatitis before the vaccine was given at birth - now the shot may be delayed again US health secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr has questioned the safety of the vaccine and downplayed the risk of contracting the virus. Cough medicine or lemon and honey: Which is better for you? Neanderthal 1: The incredible discovery that rewrote history Warning over cosmetic face fillers as scans reveal new details of risks Culture Euphoria creator teases new storylines for the show's third season Zendaya, Sydney Sweeney, Jacob Elordi among stars back in the HBO drama after four years. Painting hidden in Dorset Almshouse sells for £5.7m Steve Cropper, guitarist of Booker T and the MGs, dies aged 84 The 'It Girl' style wars of Renaissance Italy Arts Why Shakespeare's wife and son remain a mystery Oscar-tipped new film Hamnet imagines the home life of William and Agnes Shakespeare – and the "soul-crushing" loss of their child. It's a powerful story that fills in many blanks. This Indigenous winter scene is not what it seems Why dancing is key to our humanity What ancient women really thought about sex Watch Neanderthal 1: The incredible discovery that rewrote history This peaceful German valley is where the first Neanderthal was discovered and identified as a separate species. See more Travel A stylist's guide to New York City shopping She styles A-list fashionistas but really loves shopping for friends and family. Just in time for the holidays, here are Erin Walsh's top shops in her beloved hometown of NYC. Five of the world's safest countries in 2025 Seven travel trends that will define 2026 The Maldives is becoming surprisingly affordable World's Table The controversial snack that fuels Norwegian trips Kvikk Lunsj has fuelled outdoor adventures for generations. So, what makes Norway's 'trip chocolate' so controversial? The hidden history of a classic American dish What Mamdani's win means for NYC's food scene Why Marseille restaurants are offering gourmet food for €1 Earth The 'extinct' antelope roaming the Sahara once more The scimitar-horned oryx has been brought back from extinction through captive breeding. Conservationists hope it could help slow the spread of the Sahara Desert. Delhi records 200,000 acute respiratory illness cases amid toxic air Cyclone catastrophe in Sri Lanka awakens volunteer spirit The batteries powering the fastest racing EVs Video Young leopard tries to steal a meal from her own mother A young leopard, bold but inexperienced, dares to steal a hard-won kill from her own mother. When Hugh Jackman did karaoke with Neil Diamond The centuries-old festival in the heart of Rome A virtual trip aboard the Titanic Discover more from the BBC Sign up to Tech Decoded Decode the biggest developments in global technology, in your inbox every Monday and Friday. Download the BBC app Click here to download the BBC app for Apple and Android devices. US Politics Unspun No noise. No agenda. Just expert analysis of the issues that matter most from Anthony Zurcher, every Wednesday. Register for a BBC account Don't have time to read everything right now? Your BBC account lets you save articles and videos for later. Sign up for the Essential List The week's best stories, handpicked by BBC editors, in your inbox every Tuesday and Friday.
